text: S&P 500 rises to record high, led by gains in tech: Live updates - CNBC
fullText: More than 90 S&P 500 companies are slated to report quarterly results this week.

text: One person in critical condition after being shot in incident involving Border Patrol in Arizona - NBC News
fullText: A person was shot in an incident involving U.S. Border Patrol in Arizona on Tuesday, according to a Pima County Sheriff spokeswoman.

text: US to send ICE agents to Winter Olympics, prompting Italian anger - BBC
fullText: The US federal agency says it will not play an immigration role at February's event in Milan-Cortina.

text: Yankees Claim Dom Hamel; Designate Marco Luciano, Jayvien Sandridge For Assignment - MLB Trade Rumors
South Carolina measles outbreak is largest in US since measles was declared eliminated - CNN
fullText: The fast-growing measles outbreak in South Carolina is now the largest in the United States since the disease was declared eliminated in this country more than two decades ago.

text: Trump aides declared 16 DHS shootings since July justified before probes completed - The Washington Post
fullText: The Trump administration’s rush to defend the officers and accuse the victims of attacking them has sparked widespread outrage and demands for accountability.

text: Amazon to Shut Down All Amazon Go and Amazon Fresh Stores - The Wall Street Journal
fullText: Online retail giant will convert some locations into Whole Foods Market stores as it expands the brand’s footprint

text: Kylie Jenner and Timothée Chalamet Shop for Bikinis on Mexico Vacation - TMZ
fullText: Kylie Jenner and Timothée Chalamet must've packed light for their trip to Los Cabos, because they went shopping for some sexy swimwear ... and it's all on video.

text: Why There's Simply No Need For An iPad Anymore - bgr.com
fullText: Apple may finally be releasing the iPhone Fold this year, as well as a MacBook with touchscreen capabilities, eliminating the need for an iPad.

text: Carney denies walking back Davos speech in phone call with Trump - BBC
fullText: The Canadian prime minister confirmed that he and the US president spoke by phone after Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Canada.

text: Android adds ‘Failed Authentication Lock’ setting, boosts failed passcode lockout - 9to5Google
fullText: Google today detailed the latest device theft protection features for Android across stronger authentication and enhanced recovery tools.

text: Sri Lanka vs England: Joe Root and Harry Brook centuries take tourists to ODI series win - BBC
fullText: Joe Root and Harry Brook both hit brilliant, unbeaten centuries as England beat Sri Lanka by 53 runs to clinch an ODI series win in Colombo.

text: As Trump shuffles global order, U.K. prime minister heads to Beijing - The Washington Post
fullText: Keir Starmer’s visit is part of a flurry of diplomacy between Europe and China, but risks angering President Donald Trump.

text: What to know about the deadly Nipah virus, amid outbreak in India - The Washington Post
fullText: Some airports in Asia are on alert after confirmed cases in West Bengal of the  Nipah virus, which has no cure. South Asia sees outbreaks nearly every year.

text: Philip Glass pulls world premiere from Kennedy Center - The Washington Post
fullText: The pioneering composer announced that “the values of the Kennedy Center today are in direct conflict with the message” of his Symphony No. 15: “Lincoln.”

text: Could another storm hit the East Coast this weekend? See the scenarios. - The Washington Post
fullText: More snow is probably on its way. Multiple weather models are simulating what could be another system that brings plowable snow to parts of the East.

text: Consumer confidence collapses to lowest level since 2014 - CNN
fullText: America’s economic mood deteriorated in January to its lowest level in more than a decade as consumers fretted about geopolitical tensions, affordability and President Donald Trump’s unrelenting trade war.

text: First wrongful death lawsuit filed against Trump administration over drug boat strikes - NBC News
fullText: WASHINGTON — Family members of two Trinidadian men who were killed in a U.S. strike on an alleged drug-smuggling boat in October sued the U.S. government Tuesday, accusing it of wrongful death and extrajudicial killings

text: NBA mock draft 2026: Lottery simulation delivers young star to big winner - SB Nation
After rocky start, Bari Weiss to cut staff, add commentators at CBS News - NPR
fullText: CBS News Editor-in-Chief Bari Weiss came in with a mandate to reshape coverage. She laid out her strategy in a staff meeting Tuesday.
